required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: School-based Behavioural Intervention to Face Obesity and Promote Cardiovascular Health Among Spanish Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: School-based Behavioural Intervention to Face Obesity and Promote Cardiovascular Health Among Spanish Adolescents: a Cluster-randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Fundación Centro Nacional de Investigaciones Cardiovasculares Carlos III

brief_summary.textblock:
Background and objective:
There is an alarming increase in obesity and unhealthy lifestyles in adolescents. This issue threatens to have a highly negative health and socioeconomic impact in the near future. The only way to tackle this epidemic is to implement effective preventive strategies able to positively impact on youth lifestyle behaviours. The school is the most appropriate environment for such an intervention. The main objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of a comprehensive educational school-based intervention in adolescents on cardiovascular health, including obesity/adiposity and metabolic profiles. The project consortium constitutes a unique framework of research groups at the forefront of novel and successful approaches aiming to healthier behaviours and dietary habits.
Methodology:
A cluster-randomized controlled trial involving 24 secondary schools in Spain will be carried out. Schools will be 1:1:1 randomized to receive a short-term (2-year) or a long-term (4-year) comprehensive educational program, or to receive the usual curriculum (control). Participants will be evaluated at baseline, and after 2 and 4 years with the following: weight scale, circumference measuring tape, bioelectrical impedance, dual energy X-ray absorptiometry, sphygmomanometer, blood analysis, saliva and urine analysis, accelerometers, and questionnaires. The primary outcome is the change in obesity and other health parameters from baseline to year 2 and 4, as assessed by the Ideal Cardiovascular Health score. Secondary outcomes include the change in adiposity, anthropometry and body composition parameters, physical activity and dietary habits, polyphenol and carotenoid intake, metabolomics and attitudes. Participants will be measured again when they reach 20 years old.
Expected results:
The investigators expects to show that a school-based educational intervention induces favourable lifestyle changes and improves cardiovascular health among Spanish adolescents, including obesity/adiposity and metabolic profiles. If successful, this strategy could be widely adopted having a meaningful effect on obesity and cardiovascular health promotion. Additionally, associations of health parameters with bioactive dietary compounds intake and metabolic profiles will be stablished.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in obesity from baseline to year 2 and 4
primary_outcome.description: Change in obesity and other health parameters from baseline to year 2 and 4, as assessed by the Ideal Cardiovascular Health (ICH) score, as recommended by the American Heart Association (Lloyd-Jones et al., 2010). The ICH score measures cardiovascular health and includes 7 components: - Behaviors factors: No smoking Being physically active Good nutritional habits Normal weight - Health factors: Normal blood pressure Normal cholesterol level Normal glucose levels To meet the complete definition of ideal cardiovascular health, an individual would need to meet the ideal levels of all 7 components.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body mass index from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body mass index (kg/m^2), calculated after measure weight (kg) and height (meter).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in waist circumference from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist circumference (cm) measured in triplicate at the level of the umbilicus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in percentage of body fat from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total adiposity measured by bioelectrical impedance (percentage of fat).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in distribution of body fat from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change in adiposity distribution measured by dual energy X-ray absorptiometry, that calculate total body fat, regional fat, including android, gynoid and visceral, and lean mass.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in diet habits from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the association between changes in adiposity parameters and food and nutrient intake. To assess changes in diet and adherence to the Mediterranean diet will use a validated Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ) (Tresserra-Rimbau et al., 2013). Additional validated shorter questionnaires will be used to assess attitudes about food (Lima-Serrano et al., 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in polyphenol consumption from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary polyphenol (PP) intake will be estimated from FFQ and data from the PP content in foods, obtained from the Phenol-explorer data base. With this methodology, it can obtain an estimation of total PP intake by each individual and different PP classes. For the determination of phenolics and their metabolites in human urine, will be used solid-phase extraction and ultra-HPLC coupled to mass spectrometry (Martinez-Huelamo et al., 2015).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in carotenoids consumption from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Carotenoids and retinol consumption will be also estimate from the FFQ. Total energy and micronutrient intake will be obtained using the Food Processor Nutrition and Fitness Software (ESHA Research, Salem, OR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in energy and nutrients consumption from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Total energy and micronutrient intake will be obtained from a validated Food Frequency Questionnaire (Tresserra-Rimbau et al., 2013) using the Food Processor Nutrition and Fitness Software.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in metabolomics from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effect on metabolism in the intervention groups vs. control group through a metabolomics approach. Urine and salivary samples will be collected to perform a metabolomics analysis in order to evaluate metabolic changes due to educational intervention on dietary and physical activity habits. Liquid chromatography coupled to quadrupole timeof-flight mass spectrometry (HPLC-q-TOF) will be used for such analysis which is able to measure thousands of metabolites simultaneously from only minimal amounts of sample. Data mining analysis will be performed using XCMS-R package. The preprocessed data obtained by XCMS in negative and positive ionization will be separately exported to SIMCA 13.0.3 software (Umetrics) to perform unsupervised and supervised multivariate analysis to detect metabolic changes among groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: To study the association between changes in adiposity parameters and physical activity measured by accelerometer. Actigraph wGT3X-BT accelerometers that allows the registration of the amount and intensity of physical activity will be used. To complete this information a diary with questions about the type of physical activity that have performed during the days they worn the accelerometer, namely 7 days per evaluation time-point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change sedentary habits from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: To study the association between changes in adiposity parameters and physical activity measured by questionnaires. A validated questionnaire will be also used to assess attitudes about physical activity (Hagstromer et al., 2008). In addition, we will measure sedentary habits from leisure time spent with the computer/console/TV /mobile.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in attitude from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the relationship between changes in adiposity and attitudes. The attitudes towards abuse substances will be assessed by a validated questionnaire (Lima-Serrano et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in smoking attitude from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: An additional questionnaire will be used to assess knowledge about smoking, smoking status itself, and in its immediate environment (Lana, 2010; Moreno C, 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perception of the self-image from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire to assess the perception of the self-image to obtain a pattern of individual acceptance or not with his/her figure and an analysis of the canons of beauty in this age group (Stunkard et al., 1990).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-esteem from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Self-esteem will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Jauregui-Lobera et al., 2014).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in emotional eating from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Emotional eating will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Selfefficacy from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Selfefficacy will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mood from baseline to year 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: Mood will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate shorter vs. longer educational intervention effectiveness by comparison of 2 and 4 year results on all outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of a shorter vs. longer educational intervention program (2 and 4 year) will be assessed by comparison of final (4 year) results on all proposed outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiovascular score validation
secondary_outcome.description: BEWAT score will be applied, it consists of the assessment of the following: Blood pressure, Exercise, Weight, Alimentation (fruit and vegetables) and Tobacco consumption. This simple and non-invasive score (score from 0 to 15 points) will be validated against the ICH score, and will serve for future studies in adolescents.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in obesity from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Change in obesity and other health parameters from baseline to year 2 and 4, as assessed by the Ideal Cardiovascular Health (ICH) score, as recommended by the American Heart Association (Lloyd-Jones et al., 2010). The ICH score measures cardiovascular health and includes 7 components: - Behaviors factors: No smoking Being physically active Good nutritional habits Normal weight - Health factors: Normal blood pressure Normal cholesterol level Normal glucose levels To meet the complete definition of ideal cardiovascular health, an individual would need to meet the ideal levels of all 7 components.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body mass index from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body mass index (kg/m^2), calculated after measure weight (kg) and height (meter).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in waist circumference from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist circumference (cm) measured in triplicate at the level of the umbilicus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in percentage of body fat from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total adiposity measured by bioelectrical impedance (percentage of fat).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in distribution of body fat from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Change in adiposity distribution measured by dual energy X-ray absorptiometry, that calculate total body fat, regional fat, including android, gynoid and visceral, and lean mass.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in diet habits from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the association between changes in adiposity parameters and food and nutrient intake. To assess changes in diet and adherence to the Mediterranean diet will use a validated Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ) (Tresserra-Rimbau et al., 2013). Additional validated shorter questionnaires will be used to assess attitudes about food (Lima-Serrano et al., 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in polyphenol consumption from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary polyphenol (PP) intake will be estimated from FFQ and data from the PP content in foods, obtained from the Phenol-explorer data base. With this methodology, it can obtain an estimation of total PP intake by each individual and different PP classes. For the determination of phenolics and their metabolites in human urine, will be used solid-phase extraction and ultra-HPLC coupled to mass spectrometry (Martinez-Huelamo et al., 2015).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in carotenoids consumption from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Carotenoids and retinol consumption will be also estimate from the FFQ. Total energy and micronutrient intake will be obtained using the Food Processor Nutrition and Fitness Software (ESHA Research, Salem, OR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in energy and nutrients consumption from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Total energy and micronutrient intake will be obtained from a validated Food Frequency Questionnaire (Tresserra-Rimbau et al., 2013) using the Food Processor Nutrition and Fitness Software.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: To study the association between changes in adiposity parameters and physical activity measured by accelerometer. Actigraph wGT3X-BT accelerometers that allows the registration of the amount and intensity of physical activity will be used. To complete this information a diary with questions about the type of physical activity that have performed during the days they worn the accelerometer, namely 7 days per evaluation time-point.

secondary_outcome.description: To study the association between changes in adiposity parameters and physical activity measured by questionnaires. A validated questionnaire will be also used to assess attitudes about physical activity (Hagstromer et al., 2008). In addition, we will measure sedentary habits from leisure time spent with the computer/console/TV /mobile.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in attitude from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the relationship between changes in adiposity and attitudes. The attitudes towards abuse substances will be assessed by a validated questionnaire (Lima-Serrano et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in smoking attitude from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: An additional questionnaire will be used to assess knowledge about smoking, smoking status itself, and in its immediate environment (Lana, 2010; Moreno C, 2012).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perception of the self-image from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire to assess the perception of the self-image to obtain a pattern of individual acceptance or not with his/her figure and an analysis of the canons of beauty in this age group (Stunkard et al., 1990).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-esteem from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Self-esteem will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Jauregui-Lobera et al., 2014).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in emotional eating from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Emotional eating will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Selfefficacy from baseline to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Selfefficacy will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mood from baseline to to adulthood
secondary_outcome.description: Mood will be assessed using validated questionnaire (Vázquez Fernández et al., 2013).

arm_group.description: The usual educational program is applied
A two-year specially designed educational program is applied. This program aims to encourage a healthy lifestyle through gamification, including diet education, physical activity and self esteem.
A four-year specially designed educational program is applied. This program aims to encourage a healthy lifestyle through gamification, including diet education, physical activity and self esteem.

intervention.description: Comprehensive educational school-based intervention in adolescents on cardiovascular health, including obesity/adiposity and metabolic profiles, through classroom intervention, and complementary intervention in the family setting, at school and on teachers.

Comprehensive educational school-based intervention in adolescents on cardiovascular health, including obesity/adiposity and metabolic profiles, through classroom intervention, and complementary intervention in the family setting, at school and on teachers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any student studying first of ESO in the selected high schools.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria.

overall_official.affiliation: Fundación Centro Nacional de Investigaciones Cardiovasculares Carlos III

facility.name: School of Pharmacy. University of Barcelona.
